intro: Canthium venosum, commonly known as the veiny sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant features palmate leaves with prominent veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Canthium venosum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
